intro: Metastelma anegadense, commonly known as the Anegada morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the British Virgin Islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
